Row.Text: Historic Events represent monumental achievements that may occur during a game. These events require planning or user interaction, and are thus a dynamic part of acquiring cultural influence over other civilizations. When one of the following Historic Events is completed, receive a [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism boost with all known Civs based on your recent [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Earn a [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Build a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] World Wonder[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Win a [ICON_WAR] War (Warscore 25+)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Enter a new [ICON_RESEARCH] Era[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Start a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age ('Heritage' Policy only)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Complete an [ICON_RES_ARTIFACTS] Archaeological Dig ('Heritage' Policy only)[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Trade with a [ICON_CITY_STATE] City-State ('Cultural Diplomacy' Policy Only)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The amount of Tourism received by these events is based on your culture and tourism per turn over the past few turns. The value of this is also adjusted based on the number of cities in your empire and your tourism modifier with the target civ. Finally, the amount of tourism you receive is also modified by a few social policies and ideological tenets, as well as leader traits, buildings, and the number of cities in your empire.

Resistance is a mechanic through which Civilizations that have conquered one or more Capitals will find it increasingly difficult to capture additional Capitals. During combat, you may see the modifier [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Resistance (Domination)[ENDCOLOR] appear for you (a bonus) or for the enemy (a penalty). This modifier only appears after either you or your opponent have captured an enemy Capital. The modifier changes based on the number of foreign (non-City-State) Capitals owned and the number of foreign Capitals in total. The more Capitals captured by one player, the higher this penalty becomes!

If you choose to raze a City, there is a chance each turn that the City will spawn Partisans loyal to the Civilization you conquered this City from. These units will only spawn if you are still at war with the Civilization. If you are no longer at war, any spawned Partisans will be considered Barbarians. Be careful with aggressively razing enemy Cities, as the sudden appearance of Partisans could turn the tide against you!

War, war never changes. Well, actually, it does. As the game progresses, the citizens of your empire will become more and more aware of the dangers of prolonged conflict, and will begin to develop [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]War Weariness[ENDCOLOR]. War Weariness is calculated based on two factors: the length of your longest current war (however long that may be), and the largest amount of damage your cities and armies have sustained in a single combat against an opponent you are currently fighting. Every City lost or unit destroyed will increase your War Weariness, leading to three major effects:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Unhappiness from War Weariness[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Increased Production and Gold costs for Military Units[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Reduced maximum Military Unit Supply Cap.[NEWLINE]The latter two cap at 75%. Be careful of overextending during a single conflict!

The maximum number of Military Units you can field at any one time is called your Military Unit Supply Cap. This number, indicated on the Top Panel next to the [ICON_WAR] Symbol, increases based on two factors: the total population of all of your cities, and the number of buildings or policies you have that increase your Military Unit Supply Cap. Some buildings, such as the Barracks, increase your Supply Cap by a fixed amount. Others, like Walls, increase your Supply cap by a percentage of the city's population.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Military Unit Supply Cap increases from static elements, like Barracks, and percentage bonuses from population decline over time based on your empire's technological level. You will need more and more percentage bonuses to overcome this and field large armies![NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If, for any reason, you exceed your Military Unit Supply Cap, you will be penalized 5% Production and Food in all Cities (per unit over the cap).
Rearrange owned Great Works into potential Themes. Does not swap Great Works with other Civilizations and removes any Great Works already up for trade.
Rearrange Great Works into potential Themes. Swaps Great Works with other Civilizations and may put excess Great Works up for trade (if needed).
총: {1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH] 과학 (도시 국가에 대한 [ICON_INFLUENCE] 영향력 때문에)

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]정략 결혼:[ENDCOLOR] Your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence does not decay, you gain +1 Delegate to the World Congress, and +15% [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Person Rate in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
The great wealth brought back by your {1_UnitType} has led your empire to celebrate "We Love the King Day" for [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] Turns!

Your {1_UnitType} journeyed to a far-off land and discovered [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_ResourceNames}[ENDCOLOR]! [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{3_Num}[ENDCOLOR] copies of this Resource were given to you in honor of your patronage.

Your {1_UnitType} increased your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence in {3_CivShortDesc} by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR], and reduced the Influence of all Major Civilizations known to the City-State by the same amount!

A {1_UnitType} increased {4_OwnerAdj} [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence in {3_CivShortDesc} by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR], and reduced your [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence in the City-State by the same amount!
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Cannot be selected until you have founded a Religion (or have a majority Religion), or you've reached the Renaissance Era[ENDCOLOR]
{2_ResourceName:textkey} is now available in {1_CityName:textkey}! This increases [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when building pre-Industrial Era Wonders in this city by {3_Num}%!
Every [ICON_PUPPET] non-Puppet owned city ([ICON_CAPITAL] 수도 제외) decreases the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism you produce from Cities and Historic Events by {1_Num}% (up to 75%).
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]City Modifier from Water Blockade (Enemy Naval Units adjacent to City): {1_Num}%

군사 유닛의 수: {2_Num}[NEWLINE]현재 군사 보급: {1_Num}[NEWLINE][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]전쟁 피로도 보급 한도 감소: {6_Num}%[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]군사 보급 기본 수치:[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]+{4_Num} 소유한 [ICON_CITY_STATE] 도시에서[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]+{3_Num} from total [ICON_CITIZEN] Population[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET]+{5_Num} from [ICON_CHECKBOX] Handicap[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Military Supply Reductions:[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] -{8_Num} from [ICON_RESEARCH] Tech Level[NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] -{7_Num} from [ICON_WAR] War Weariness[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Military Unit [ICON_PRODUCTION]/[ICON_GOLD] Costs increased by {9_Num}% due to [ICON_WAR] War Weariness.[NEWLINE]
Expending {1_UnitName} increased your Military Unit Supply Cap by {2_Num}!
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]They have a Defensive Pact with someone![ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]We have a Defensive Pact with them![ENDCOLOR]
{1_SpyRank} {2_SpyName} may not attempt a coup in {3_CityName} yet because their current Ally has a Sphere of Influence here.
총: {1_Num} [ICON_FOOD] 식량 (페이토리아에서)[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]These values are modified by your relationship status (Neutral/Friend/Ally) with the City-State.
총: {1_Num} [ICON_CULTURE] 문화 (due to [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence over this City-State)
{1_CivName} has unlocked {2_Num} more Policies than you.
You have unlocked {1_Num} more Policies than {2_CivName}.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture that the destination city would receive from this trade route.
Click to sort by the amount of [ICON_CULTURE] Culture that the civilization that established the trade route generates from this trade route.
함대 수리를 사용할 수 있는 횟수로 0이 되면 기능을 상실합니다.
Your soldiers found information worth {1_Num} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science during the conquest of {2_Name}!
정책을 완성했습니다! 무료 기술을 선택할 수 있습니다...
이념을 선택할 수 있습니다! 무료 기술을 선택할 수 있습니다...
종교를 채택했습니다! 무료 기술을 선택할 수 있습니다...
The birth of a {1_Resource:textkey} causes the city of {2_CityName:textkey} to enter "We Love the Empress Day.' All Cities gain +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Entering a new Era has led to instability and the rise of a new ruling dynasty. Bonus [ICON_FOOD] Food and [ICON_GOLD] Gold from Mandate of Heaven is halved in all Cities.

The creation of a [ICON_GREAT_WORK] Great Work causes all Cities to enter "We Love the Empress Day" for {1_Num} Turns, increasing their [ICON_FOOD] Food by +{2_Num}%! All Cities gain +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
The acquisition of {1_Resource:textkey} causes the city of {2_CityName:textkey} to enter "We Love the Empress Day" for {3_Num} Turns, increasing their [ICON_FOOD] Food by +{4_Num}%!

The founding of a new City causes all Cities to enter "We Love the Empress Day" for {1_Num} Turns, increasing their [ICON_FOOD] Food by +{2_Num}%! All Cities gain +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.

The conquest of a City causes all Cities to enter "We Love the Empress Day" for {1_Num} Turns, increasing their [ICON_FOOD] Food by +{2_Num}%! All Cities gain +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]"We Love the Empress Day" Modifier: +{1_Num}% [ICON_FOOD] Food
The City of {1_CityName:textkey} wants {2_ResourceName:textkey}! Connecting that resource to your trade network will cause the city to enter "We Love the Empress Day."
This City is in "We Love the Empress Day", which increases the City's [ICON_FOOD] Food modifier!
Connecting this Resource to your trade network will cause this City to go into "We Love the Empress Day."
This City is celebrating Carnaval, which increases [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_FOOD] Growth, and reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Unhappiness!
Connecting this Resource to your trade network will cause this City to celebrate Carnaval, which increases [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and [ICON_FOOD] Growth, and reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Unhappiness!

If this City-State is more [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]afraid[ENDCOLOR] of you than they are [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]resilient[ENDCOLOR], you can take exact heavy tribute from them. Doing so will net you [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_PEACE] Faith, or [ICON_FOOD] Food, depending on the City-State being targeted.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The amount you can exact in tribute is based on Game Speed and the Yield output of your Capital. Local Yields, like [ICON_FOOD] Food or [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, will be delivered to your Capital.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{1_FearLevel}{2_FactorDetails}
Because you are burning their city to the ground, partisans have spawned near {1_Name}!
Because your captured city is being burned to the ground, friendly partisans have spawned near {1_Name}!

Your musicians were happily received by the {1_PlayerAdj} people. You gain +[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism with them, and +{3_num} [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
{1_PlayerAdj} musicians recently toured your empire, and were warmly received. {1_PlayerAdj} [ICON_TOURISM] Cultural Influence over you has increased by [COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]{2_Num}[ENDCOLOR].
Barbarians looted {2_City}, stealing treasures worth {1_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold![NEWLINE]Destroy these Barbarians before they steal more stuff!
Barbarians raided {2_City}, destroying relics worth {1_Culture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture![NEWLINE]Destroy these Barbarians before they break more stuff!
Barbarians assaulted {2_City}, destroying research materials worth {1_Science} [ICON_RESEARCH] Science![NEWLINE]Destroy these Barbarians before they burn more things!
Barbarians pillaged the stores of {2_City}, taking {1_Food} [ICON_FOOD] Food![NEWLINE]Destroy these Barbarians before they take more stuff!
Barbarians kidnapped citizens from {2_City}, costing the city {1_Production} [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production![NEWLINE]Destroy these Barbarians before they cause more panic!
Because the City of {1_CityName:textkey} has {2_Population} [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens, a {3_Unit} has been conscripted!
Because you adopted the Conscription policy and {1_CityName:textkey} has more than 8 [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens, a {2_Unit} has been conscripted!
A Logging Camp allows you to improve the Gold output of Jungle tiles. Gains additional Gold for every two adjacent Logging Camps, so try to build them in clusters of three if possible.
It will increase the amount of [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production provided by this tile, while keeping the Jungle intact.
[COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]({1_Num})[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_CITIZEN]: "[ICON_WAR] War! What is it good for!?"
{1_Num} 보너스 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] from luxuries because average city size is {2_Num} [ICON_CITIZEN].
Cities cannot produce more [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] 행복 than the number of [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in the City.

[NEWLINE](These 'Needs' are averages of yields based on the number of [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizens in the City, as well as temporary situations, such as starvation or blockades. Averages increase as the game progresses, and yields per citizen decrease as a city grows. The bigger the divide between your city's yields and your empire-wide average, the higher your city's unhappiness!)

[NEWLINE](These modifiers are based on a number of factors, such as Population, Technology level, Policies, Buildings and/or Civilization Traits. Special modifiers, such as being the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital or a [ICON_PUPPET] Puppet, are highlighted. Positive modifiers raise the global average; negative modifiers reduce it.)
Requires an Ideology to become active.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]If you enter the {1_EraString:textkey} you can bypass the Policy requirement.[ENDCOLOR]
Number of Policies Remaining until Ideologies are unlocked: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_Num}[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE]Free Promotion for newly-created, valid units (if owned by player):[NEWLINE]{1_PromoteString}
{1_Num}% Penalty from lack of Trade Routes (Sakoku)[NEWLINE]

Due to the birth of {4_UnitName:textkey}, your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital gains:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GREAT_WRITER] Great Writer Points[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num}[ICON_GREAT_ARTIST] Artist Points[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{3_Num} [ICON_GREAT_MUSICIAN] Musician Points

Due to the conquest of {4_CityName}, your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital gains:[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GREAT_WRITER] Great Writer Points[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Num}[ICON_GREAT_ARTIST] Artist Points[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{3_Num} [ICON_GREAT_MUSICIAN] Musician Points
브라질의 고유 사치 자원 입니다. 오로지 브라질 소방목 벌목장을 통해서만 획득할 수 있습니다.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]독점 보너스:[ENDCOLOR] +2 [ICON_CULTURE]문화 (자원 타일)
브라질 소방목은 열대 지역에서 나는 재질이 단단한 나무로, 나무껍질에서 선명한 진홍색과 깊은 보라색을 추출하여 염료로 사용합니다. 재질이 치밀하여서 현악기, 특히 활과 고급 가구 제작에 귀중하게 쓰였습니다. 브라질 소방목 벌목은 1875년에 합성염료가 섬유 산업을 장악하고, 악기 제작에 더 좋은 목재가 발견될 때까지 계속되었습니다.
[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tech unlocks remaining until free Social Policy: {1_Num}[ENDCOLOR]

"The sea calmed and the whirlwind and flood stopped.[NEWLINE]Utnapishtim opened a window and felt fresh air on his face.[NEWLINE]He looked for coastlines at the horizon and saw a region of land.[NEWLINE]The boat lodged firmly on mount Nimush which held the boat for several days, allowing no swaying.[NEWLINE]He released a raven which was able to eat and scratch, and did not circle back to the boat.[NEWLINE]He then sent his livestock out in various directions."
직전에 제안된 결의안은 다음 대회까지 다시 제안할 수 없습니다.
{1_Num} 수입 및 통제된 사치 자원에서 (사치 자원당 평균 {2_Num})

총 [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] 불행 수치 from Empire Sources is split across all cities evenly, with any remainder divided up amongst your cities, starting with the Capital and progressing from oldest to newest (in terms of founding).

총 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] 행복 수치 from Empire Sources is split across all cities evenly, with any remainder divided up amongst your cities, starting with the Capital and progressing from oldest to newest (in terms of founding).
[ICON_PUPPET] 괴뢰 도시, [ICON_OCCUPIED] 점령 도시, [ICON_RAZE] 불타는 도시, 또는 [ICON_RESISTANCE] 저항 도시는 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] 행복을 제공하지 못하거나 제국 전역 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] 행복의 혜택을 받지 못합니다.

Your approval rating is less than 35% - your Empire is in open rebellion! Cities may abandon your Empire and flip to the Civilization that is most culturally influential over your people! Additionally, all Cities will [ICON_FOOD] Grow very slowly and have increased Military Unit and Settler costs. [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat effectiveness is also reduced by 20%!

Your approval rating is less than 20% - your Empire is fracturing! Cities will rapidly abandon your Empire and flip to the Civilization that is most culturally influential over your people! Additionally, all Cities will [ICON_FOOD] Grow more slowly and have increased Military Unit and Settler costs. [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat effectiveness is also reduced by 20%!
Your {@1_UnitName} encountered no resistance, and attacked enemy air and anti-air units on the ground!
